ticket.title: Use rbconfig's Config::CONFIG['host_os'] instead of RUBY_PLATFORM
ticket.original-body:
With reference to ticket & patch #3999. And as per suggested here [proper-way-to-detect-windows-platform-in-ruby/](http://blog.emptyway.com/2009/11/03/proper-way-to-detect-windows-platform-in-ruby/). I have replaced other occurrences of RUBY_PLATFORM with Config::CONFIG['host_os'].
See the pastie http://pastie.org/935086 for values of both.
I haven't changed the file which #3999 patch fixes, so #3999 can be applied too.
This patch is against 3.0 master branch.
Do inform me, if there are further changes needed in patch. I will update the patch.

version.title: Use rbconfig's Config::CONFIG['host_os'] instead of RUBY_PLATFORM

version.body: This patch isn't 100% correct (though it's due to the initial implementation also being wrong). `Config::CONFIG['host_os']` can also return `"cygwin"` under a cygwin build of Ruby. The regex does not take this into account.
version.body-html: This patch isn't 100% correct (though it's due to the initial implementation also being wrong). Config::CONFIG['host_os'] can also return "cygwin" under a cygwin build of Ruby. The regex does not take this into account.
